cp510.assignments.assignment7

Class DNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • cp510.assignments.assignment7.DNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DList

    public class DNode
extends java.lang.Object
    The DNode class for UW java 510 assignment 7. The Dnode class is an encapuslating class that creates nodes (objects) to be incorporated into a circular, doubly linked list. This class is mainly concerned with the individual nodes and their respective forward (flink) and backward (blink) links, position in a linked list, as well as the data contained within the node itself. It works in tandem with the DList subclass that handles operations concerned with the assembled list.
    Author:
    Toby Peterson.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DNode

        public DNode()
        The default constructor for DNode. It sets the data property to null, and initializes this object to the unenqueued state.

      • DNode

        public DNode(java.lang.Object data)
        The parameterized constructor for DNode. It takes in the data for the newly instantiated node. It also sets the flink and blink to itself, thus making it into an unenqueued state.
        Parameters:
        data - The data that the newly-instantiated object should contain.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData()
        The getData method for DNode. This is the way to get the data from the node.
        Returns:
        Object The data contained within the node.

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.Object data)
        The setData method for DNode. This is the method used to set the data for the node.
        Parameters:
        data - The data contained within the node object.

      • isEnqueued

        public boolean isEnqueued()
        The isEnqueued method for DNode. This method returns a boolean stating whether or not the node is enqueued as part of a list.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • addAfter

        public void addAfter(DNode node)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The addAfter method for DNode. This method adds a node to a circular, doubly-linked list. It specifically adds the node after this node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be placed after this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The exception thrown if the selected node is not enqueued.

      • addBefore

        public void addBefore(DNode node)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The addBefore method for DNode. This method adds a node to a circular, doubly-linked list. It specifically adds the node before this node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be placed before this node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The exception thrown if the selected node is not enqueued.

      • getNext

        public DNode getNext()
        The getNext method for DNode. It returns the next node in the list if enqueued. If not enqueued, returns this.
        Returns:
        DNode

      • getPrevious

        public DNode getPrevious()
        The getPrevious method for DNode. It returns the previous node in the list if enqueued. If not enqueued, returns this.
        Returns:
        DNode

      • remove

        public DNode remove()
        The remove method for DNode. It removes this node from the queue that contains it, if any. It is not a mistake if this node is not enqueued. Returns this.
        Returns:
        this
